This is a GREAT video about the Task Parallel Library (TPL), and what C# 5 (.NET 4.5) adds on top of it. It tells you how much you "may" be underestimating the magic AND POWER of async/await features, with a great (not too) simple example.
Found at http://blog.michaelckennedy.net/2012/07/23/asynchronous-programming-in-net-4-5-video/

posts.caption: developers.google.com
posts.description: Once resources have been downloaded to the client, the browser still needs to load, interpret, and render HTML, CSS, and JavaScript code. By simply formatting your code and pages in ways that exploit the characteristics of current browsers, you can enhance performance on the client side.
